title: Create Qt MML_RealFunctionVisualizer
description:
Create third implementation of RealFunctionVisualizer using Qt + OpenGL for cross-platform 2D function visualization.

CONTEXT:
- WPF implementation exists (C#/XAML, Windows-only)
- FLTK implementation exists (C++/FLTK, cross-platform 2D)
- Qt implementation will add OpenGL-accelerated rendering with modern UI

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Follow Qt/MML_ParametricCurve3D_Visualizer architecture pattern:
   - MainWindow.cpp/h: Qt Widgets UI with controls
   - GLWidget.cpp/h: QOpenGLWidget for 2D rendering
   - MMLData.h: Data structures (Point2D, LoadedRealFunction)
   - MMLFileParser.cpp/h: Parse REAL_FUNCTION_DATA format
   - CMakeLists.txt: Qt6 + OpenGL configuration
   - README.md: Complete documentation
   - build.bat: Automated build script

2. Data format compatibility:
   - Read REAL_FUNCTION_DATA from WPF/MML_RealFunctionVisualizer/data/
   - Support multiple functions simultaneously
   - Format: NumPoints, xMin, xMax, followed by x,y pairs

3. Features to implement:
   - Load multiple functions with color coding
   - Interactive zoom/pan (mouse controls)
   - Coordinate axes with labels
   - Grid lines
   - Function legend with statistics
   - Auto-fit view button
   - Export view as image (optional)

4. Technical details:
   - Use 2D orthographic projection in OpenGL
   - Implement coordinate transformation (world  screen)
   - Add #define NOMINMAX to prevent Windows macro conflicts
   - Deploy Qt DLLs with windeployqt after build
   - Follow C++17 standard

5. Testing:
   - Test with WPF data: cosh.txt, sinh.txt, sin.txt, cos.txt
   - Verify multi-function loading
   - Test zoom/pan interactions
   - Validate against FLTK version behavior

DELIVERABLES:
- Complete Qt/MML_RealFunctionVisualizer/ directory
- All source files (MainWindow, GLWidget, MMLData, MMLFileParser, main)
- CMakeLists.txt with proper Qt6 dependencies
- README.md with build/usage instructions
- build.bat for automated builds
- Successfully runs and visualizes test data

title: Port Qt ParametricCurve3D_Visualizer to Linux
description:
Port MML_ParametricCurve3D_Visualizer (Qt + OpenGL) to work on Linux alongside Windows.

COMPLETED WORK:
1. Located Qt 6.9.3 installation at /home/zvanjak/Qt/6.9.3/gcc_64/
2. Fixed CMakeLists.txt for cross-platform OpenGL linking:
   - Windows: Links opengl32 library
   - Linux: Uses Qt6::OpenGLWidgets (no explicit OpenGL lib needed)
   - macOS: Links OpenGL framework
3. Successfully built application on Ubuntu 24.04 with GCC 13.3.0
4. Tested with example15_curve3D.txt - application runs correctly

TECHNICAL CHANGES:
- Modified CMakeLists.txt to conditionally link OpenGL based on platform
- Removed hardcoded opengl32 dependency that only works on Windows
- Added platform detection: WIN32, APPLE, else (Linux)

BUILD COMMAND:
cmake -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/home/zvanjak/Qt/6.9.3/gcc_64 .. && make

RESULT:
- Executable: 187 KB at build/bin/MML_ParametricCurve3D_Visualizer
- Minor warnings: QMatrix4x4 deprecation (cosmetic, no impact)
- Application fully functional with 3D parametric curve visualization
